intro: Cathcartia chelidoniifolia, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not commonly found in commercial horticulture.
